trans-unit.source: How to configure Microsoft Account authentication for your App Services application
trans-unit.target: How to configure Microsoft Account authentication for your App Services application

trans-unit.source: Learn how to configure Microsoft Account authentication for your App Services application.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to configure Microsoft Account authentication for your App Services application.

trans-unit.source: How to configure your application to use Microsoft Account login
trans-unit.target: How to configure your application to use Microsoft Account login

trans-unit.source: This topic shows you how to configure Azure Mobile Apps to use Microsoft Account as an authentication provider.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows you how to configure Azure Mobile Apps to use Microsoft Account as an authentication provider.

trans-unit.source: Register your application with Microsoft Account
trans-unit.target: Register your application with Microsoft Account

trans-unit.source: Log on to the [Azure Management Portal], and navigate to your Mobile App.
trans-unit.target: Log on to the [Azure Management Portal], and navigate to your Mobile App.

trans-unit.source: Click **Settings**, **User authentication**, and then click **Microsoft Account**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Settings**, **User authentication**, and then click **Microsoft Account**.

trans-unit.source: Copy the **Redirect URL**.
trans-unit.target: Copy the **Redirect URL**.

trans-unit.source: You will use this to configure a new app for your Microsoft Account.
trans-unit.target: You will use this to configure a new app for your Microsoft Account.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the [My Applications] page in the Microsoft Account Developer Center, and log on with your Microsoft account, if required.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the [My Applications] page in the Microsoft Account Developer Center, and log on with your Microsoft account, if required.

trans-unit.source: Click **Create application**, then type an **Application name** and click **I accept**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Create application**, then type an **Application name** and click **I accept**.

trans-unit.source: Click **API Settings**.
trans-unit.target: Click **API Settings**.

trans-unit.source: Select **Yes** for **Mobile or desktop client app**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Yes** for **Mobile or desktop client app**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Redirect URL** field, enter the **Redirect URL** you copied earlier.
trans-unit.target: In the **Redirect URL** field, enter the **Redirect URL** you copied earlier.

trans-unit.source: This is the Mobile App gateway appended with, _/signin-microsoft_.
trans-unit.target: This is the Mobile App gateway appended with, _/signin-microsoft_.

trans-unit.source: For example, `https://contosogateway.azurewebsites.net/signin-microsoft`.
trans-unit.target: For example, `https://contosogateway.azurewebsites.net/signin-microsoft`.

trans-unit.source: Make sure that you are using the HTTPS scheme.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that you are using the HTTPS scheme.

trans-unit.source: After entering the redirect URL, click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: After entering the redirect URL, click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]For an existing Microsoft Account app registration, you may have to first enable **Enhanced redirection security**.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]For an existing Microsoft Account app registration, you may have to first enable **Enhanced redirection security**.

trans-unit.source: Click **App Settings** and make a note of the values of the **Client ID** and **Client secret**.
trans-unit.target: Click **App Settings** and make a note of the values of the **Client ID** and **Client secret**.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The client secret is an important security credential.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The client secret is an important security credential.

trans-unit.source: Do not share the client secret with anyone or distribute it within a client application.
trans-unit.target: Do not share the client secret with anyone or distribute it within a client application.

trans-unit.source: Add Microsoft Account information to your Mobile App
trans-unit.target: Add Microsoft Account information to your Mobile App

trans-unit.source: Back in the [Azure Management Portal] on the Microsoft Account setting blade for your Mobile App, paste in the Client ID and Client Secret values which you obtained previously.
trans-unit.target: Back in the [Azure Management Portal] on the Microsoft Account setting blade for your Mobile App, paste in the Client ID and Client Secret values which you obtained previously.

trans-unit.source: Then click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Then click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: You are now ready to use Microsoft Account for authentication in your app.
trans-unit.target: You are now ready to use Microsoft Account for authentication in your app.

trans-unit.source: Related Content
trans-unit.target: Related Content

trans-unit.target: test
